channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Brand New Street Light not working., 1st September
item.description:
This new street light has never worked since it was installed a couple of weeks ago. The light is outside number 16 Princes Plain BR2 8LE.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Gravel Road, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Items, 1st September
item.description:
On North Cray Road at the junction with Bunkers Hill, Sidcup: Please could you remove two dumped builders sacks of waste from the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bunkers Hill, North Cray, London

item.title: Litter Bin Full, 1st September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, North Cray Road, Bexley, London

item.title: 8 street lights out., 1st September
item.description:
6 street lights on right hand side junction of Brickfield Cottages going down towards Wicks. 2 street lights out left hand side of kings highway by flats and houses so kings highway is very dark for people walking along kings highway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Highway, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A loto fo rubis dumped on Surrey Terrace, 1st September
item.description:
This has started over a week ago and more and more fly tipping is accumulating. From an industrial fridge to wood, cloths, food. hope rats are not starting soon to live there. Please remove as soon as possible. It is a lot of fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Terrace, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Claremont Road, London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Graffiti on street sign on pedestrian crossing, 1st September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Anerley, London
